Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel as the Disney style”
Reviews.Author: CigdemS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. Arriving one day earlier than the conference start time, I had the opportunity to enjoy the pool - and the convenience of poolside chairs and towels. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful, very competent in answering questions and helping you find the best deals.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Lenny777
Reviews.Content: Stayed two eveings (3 days) with my wife and 3 teen daughters and we had a blast! Close to Downtown Disney and all Disney attractions. The room was spacious & clean and the front desk staff were excellent! Nice big pool, hot tub, and decent fitness room. Would'nt hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Centrally Located....”
Reviews.Author: Hartselljr
Reviews.Content: I'm not really sure why this hotel is rated 59th at this time. It truly deserves a much better rating. I met my son to attend the ISA 2012 Expo at the Convention Center on Universal Dr. and didn't mind the 10-15 minute drive to spend almost half on a very nice accomadation. While in town we also went to an Orlando Magic game at the Amway Center which was only about a 25 minute drive. We also visited the Premium Outlets and Downtown Disney. This hotel is truly in the middle of it all but in a very quiet area. The room itself was still as good as new. I asked one of the housekeepers how old the Hotel was and she told me 2 years. I really thought it was newer. The internet connection worked perfect. Maybe one small complaint but not a big one was that I had to print my boarding pass before leaving and the computers in the business center were very slow. When visiting Orlando again this is my new hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice near Orlando attractions”
Reviews.Author: RBCOSTA
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at this hotel. Near Downtown Disney, it is located about a 15 minute drive to Walt Disney World (6 miles away), Universal Studios (7 miles away) and Sea World (3 miles away). 10 minute drive to Premium Outlet. Very large and very confortable room (a 2 queens access evolution, near elevator - room #314), with excellent bathroom. Its a new hotel, launched in 2009, with free self parking, free wi-fi and non-smoking rooms with convenient amenities. The Midtown Bar and Grill offers freshly made breakfast, lunch and dinner. _______________________________________________________________________________ In Portuguese: Esta é a segunda vez que ficamos hospedados no hotel. Bem próximo de Downtown Disney e localizado a aproximadamente 15 minutos de Walt Disney World, Universal Studios e Sea World. Fica a 10 minutos do Premium Outlet. Nosso quarto era grande e muito confortável, com um excelente banheiro. É um hotel novo, inaugurado em 2009, com estacionamento e wi-fi também gratuitos. Todos os quartos são para não-fumantes, com várias amenidades. O bar e o restaurante oferecem café da manhã, almoço e jantar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Roxy-Popsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night after a long flight from the UK. We'd chosen this hotel as we'd stayed previously at the next door Homewood Suites. We chose this hotel because it has a restaurant so we could get something to eat without travelling anywhere. I'd chosen our room the night before when I went to run off the confirmation. We had a choice of rooms so chose a 1 bedroomed suite on the 7th floor, brilliant as we'd paid for a room only. The assistant at check in couldn't initially find our paperwork & asked us if we had got the wrong hotel. Then I said we'd checked in online & she found it. The suite was fantastic! Spacious, clean, airy & very comfortable. The very spacious bathroom could be entered via the sitting room or the bedroom. The televisions were flat screen. Didn't hear any noise whatsoever from either the corridor or outside. This hotel isn't directly fronting the I- 4 so thre's not the buzz of traffic. The evening meal we had was good & the service excellent. At breakfast the choice was standard fayre but very good. It is far more tranquil than the Homewood Suites but each fills a need in the market. The pool is shared with the Homewood Suites but I've never seen it crowded. The aircon in our bedroom was a tad noisy but bearable. I chatted to a tall slender lady who checked us out who I presume was the manager. She was very pleasant & seemed to really care about what we thought of our stay. We'd happily stay again. Thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brittney H
Reviews.Content: Just left this hotel today and have no complaints. It was clean, the beds were nice and shower had hot water, so I was happy. People find the smallest thing to complain about. You can't go to a hotel expecting it to be absolutely nothing wrong with it. Your home is perfect is it? We got free breakfast and although it was the best breakfast I ever had in my life, it got us through our morning. The pool was nice. The people were nice and at the end of the day we got what we came for and that was a good night's rest. The room had a fridge and a microwave as well. The hotel is very close to the Disney area, about a 5 minute drive to Downtown Disney, and close to many places to eat and shop, yet away from all the noise and traffic. I would most certainly stay here again when we go back to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a quick overnighter!”
Reviews.Author: tracers73
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel using Hilton points, so no complaints on the price! About 2 miles from the Downtown Disney area. Not sure if they offer a shuttle service to the parks, as I live in FL and drove my car to Orlando. Called in the morning to advise I would be arriving late so not to be surprised to find my room given away when I arrived around 10pm. All was in order, easy check in, and a nice quiet room awaited me. The rooms are very well kept, stylishly decorated, and had a microwave and coffee maker. No problems with the wifi internet service, good shower pressure, plenty of towels. Would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expect”
Reviews.Author: Fiona_822
Reviews.Content: The bedroom is good, clean, comfortable, big, but the bathroom disappointed me. It was so small and the design is weird. You cannot open the shower without getting wet! When you just open the open the shower, the water is cold, nobody wants to get the cold water on their body. The service is not that good too. My nail was broken and I ask them for nail clippers, they even don't have one

Reviews.Title: “One night to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Dalette
Reviews.Content: Spent one night going to epcot. Got there early they stored our bags and we caught the free shuttle to and from epcot. Clean facility with good night sleepo.

Reviews.Title: “NICE, CLEAN AND AWAY FORM THE CRAZINESS”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELINMANFROMNJ
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean place aways form the Disney craziness but close enough to get to the parks in minutes. Standard rooms and nice staff. Not really crazy about the air beds but they're not bad. One problem was that teh battery in my room safe was dead and i could not lock the safe. Also no luggage rack was kinda incovienient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel_19438
Reviews.Content: My family recently enjoyed a weekend stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Lake Buena Vista/Orlando. We got an excellent rate ($89/night) and the location is great -- less than 5 minute drive to Walt Disney World and Downtown Disney, and less than 15 minutes (straight shot) to Universal Orlando. Travel time from the airport was approximately 30 minutes, an easy drive (includes tolls). The rooms were comfortable and reasonably spacious, and included a medium-size flat screen TV (no DVD player or iHome). The hotel had the basic amenities most travellers would want -- on-site dining, bar, workout room, outdoor pool and hot tub. Front desk staff was very friendly, and always greeted us as we came and went. This hotel offers 3x daily shuttles to the nearby parks, but we had a rental car so we didn't use that service. Parking was free, and a business center is available if you want to print out your boarding passes etc. One minor quibble: The hotel web site advertises having a heated outdoor pool, but the water temp was only about 74 when we were there - a little cool for the grown-ups, but that didn't stop our daughter from jumping in! The hot tub was delightful, especially after a long day trekking through the theme parks. The pool area was well stocked with towels (the towel quality leaves a bit to be desired, but no big deal). This hotel is located in an area where there is literally one hotel after another after another. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Hilton Garden Inn Lake Buena Vista/Orlando as a good value option located near the major attractions of Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Quality”
Reviews.Author: Twobucks
Reviews.Content: Yet another great stay at another Hilton Garden Inn. Once again the hotel and room lived up to our expectations and I'm pleased to say that Hilton continue to make the mark. Our king bed was comfortable and the room spacious, clean and well furnished. There's also free Wi-Fi for those who need it... we didn't... The bathroom too was well fitted out and more than adequate for our needs. Breakfast can also be taken in the small restaurant/bar area adjacent to reception and, although nothing fancy, was more than acceptable for a holiday maker or busy traveller. The public areas were all very clean and airy and the whole place gave off a relaxed atmosphere. Staff too were great... Many thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visit, another good experience.”
Reviews.Author: rlewis937
Reviews.Content: On a repeat visit to this hotel I wondered what toll had been taken on a very busy hotel in the span of a year. The change was very little and I was pleasantly surprised that service and staff was much the same-a comfort when traveling is seeing a familiar face. The restaurant was well staffed and food was better than average for a hotel. I love their 'sleep system' beds and look forward to a very good night's sleep whenever I am at a Garden Inn. Another review says it is across the street from Downtown Disney - this is not true. While it is a short drive with just 2 turns, it isn't across the street. The location of this hotel is nice because it's quiet and not on a street that is heavily traveled among rows of hotels. It is the best in convenience and quiet. Nice management, nice desk help, and overall an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value / Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrianinMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December before a cruise and this was a great hotel. Really attentive and eager to help front desk staff. The bar / breakfast area was very clean with good staff as well. Rooms seemed to be clean and hotel was in an area convenient to Disney attractions, and the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: stanley23913548
Reviews.Content: Room, breakfast, hot tub, all good. Pool however, was very cold. No sign that Christmas was upon us, except one lonely wreath above the reception area. Still, would come again.

Reviews.Title: “price you cant complain - good hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: jaypee0501
Reviews.Content: Brought my family (two kids one is infant other is toddler) and its perfect for us. It has new rooms with decent bed and flat tv. Typical hilton restrooms and pools is kiddie friendly. Great location its secluded a bit but if you are driving its away from traffic. Great price and worth the stay. We even extended one more night. Breakfast not too fancy but cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Disney is across the street!”
Reviews.Author: empare
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally across the street from Downtown Disney. I loved being able to walk across the street and be surrounded by "Disneydom" for free! I was here for a business conference in October and was very happy with the service, the cleanliness and the overall hotel experience. I even had a view of the Epcot globe from my room. The transportation to the Disney parks was ontime and reliable. The gardens were quite lovely and well maintained. The business meetings and meals were very organized and timely. Overall, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE this Garden Inn!”
Reviews.Author: drdon555
Reviews.Content: I travel to Orlando quite frequently for work and this has been my go to hotel for as long as I can remember. The staff is always polite and friendly, the rooms are clean and up to date (they have neat adjustable mattresses) and the lobby restaurant has consistently tasty and diverse dinner menu options (breakfast is always fresh and tasty as well). One of the best features of the property is location, location, location, just ask the front desk for a shortcut no traffic way to I-Drive or Dr. Phillips area and it is located between Universal Studios and Disney so if your going for fun it is excellent. Great all the way around, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Resort”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Resort for business less than a week ago. This hotel has a lot more to offer to a business traveler or leisure guest. The staff is courteous and efficient. Although the kitchen that evening was experiencing issues they kindly offered to find me a suitable dinner from a local restaurant. The rooms are spacious and come equip with beds that you can adjust. The view from the room I was in had a panoramic view of the Walt Disney World Fireworks. Although a stone's throw away from Disney it is set in a quiet area of Lake Buena Vista away from the tourist traffic. I would recommend this hotel to anyone with Hilton Honors or someone who wants a luxury stay without the luxury price. Well done Garden Inn at Lake Buena Vista you have outdone yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the 1s, 2s, and 3s. This Hotel Is Great!”
Reviews.Author: NinaCherie07
Reviews.Content: It is rare that I take the time to write a review but here it goes. I've stayed at a lot 5 star hotels and had a lot of experiences but this Hilton was actually worth writing about. In early November, I found myself in Orlando without a hotel room due to no fault of my own. I was attending a large scientific conference and there were only rooms available at 2 hotels near the Orange County convention center where the conference was held...I chose the LaQuinta. Yuk is all I had to say when I arrived at 7:00pm on a Friday. I'll save the icky details for my 0 star Laquinta review. Anyway, out of desperation I called the Hilton main line and requested a property as close to the convention center as possible. I like the Hilton brand so I thought, how bad could it be. Anything was better than that nasty LaQuinta. I was told by the rep that there was 1 room available at the Hilton Garden Inn Lake Buena Vista/Orlando, so I took it. After complaining to the folks at the LaQuinta and demanding a full refund, I jumped in my rent-a-car and headed to Marbella Palm Court. They saved the day! Upon entering, I couldn't help but notice the modern decor in the place. In addition, I was greeted by 2 pleasant and pretty young ladies who politely listened to me rant about my experience at the LaQuinta. After welcoming me to the property and offering me fresh cookies I was on my way to my room...With my fingers crossed. To my surprise, I entered a very nice modern room with a fresh scent, microwave, fridge, ergonomically correct chairs, and adjustable mattresses...Everything you need to be comfortable. I'll continue...There was modern technology, a variety of cable news networks, great water pressure in the showers, down pillows, etc. For the very reasonable rate that I paid (just $20 more than the LaQuinta for my entire 5-night stay), I was very pleased. The hotel is situated about 1 to 1.5 miles away from International Drive so if you don't have a rent-a-car don't even bother. However, I loved the peace and serenity of the area so if you do have a rent-a-car...Go for it! The fitness room housed about 6 exercise machines (Precor brand) and a nice selection of dumbbells. I'm an Exercise Physiologist so this part of the hotel experience is very important to me as I exercise regularly. The food at the restaurant was terrific and reasonably priced. Breakfast was great with a great variety of food (I loved the vegetable egg white omelet for breakfast and the grilled chicken sandwich for dinner). All the restaurant staff was pleasant and very accommodating especially the dinner crew. A couple of mistakes were made with my order on separate occasions, but the staff corrected the situation with a smile. Did I mentioned the fresh coffee that's available all day? All and all, wonderful experience and I highly recommend this place. I hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Our Place to Stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: LJO_FL
Reviews.Content: We've made HGI our hotel of choice when we travel to Orlando. It's clean, nicely decorated and has great amenities for the kids. The breakfast has a wide variety of choices with waffles, french toast, and omelets. It is definitely worth it to do the breakfast add on at checkin. The hotel has a nice pool, basketball courts, and even an arcade for the kids. I have to mention the great customer service in one Bartender there, Damaris. She was always attentive and so friendly. She really was a pleasure. As far as location, The hotel is conveniently located to shopping and the Parks. I definitely recommend HGI! We will be staying again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Upset I Didn't Start Staying Here Before”
Reviews.Author: Jafo19D
Reviews.Content: I travel to Orlando every week but for some stupid reason I was staying at the Hilton Grand Vacation at Sea World. My frustrations with that hotel became unbearable so I started staying here instead and what a difference. The hotel is very new and the rooms are in better shape than your average Hilton Garden Inn. I read some reviews complaining about some strong smells in some rooms but after 2 seperate stays I have not encountered that. The rooms are quiet and like all HGIs equipped with a microwave and small fridge, internet is decent and a decent amount of accesible power outlets. Since I have Diamond status I get breakfast for free which is decent. You can get eggs to order, juices, bread, pastries, fruit, sausage, bacon..... The first week, the cook was a cheerful black guy but the second week it was a sort of grumpy latin dude. For other food choices the nearest restaurants are about a mile away. The pool and gym are pretty small. I'll definitely keep on using this place as a business traveler but if I was here on vacation with young children and lots of free time in the hotel I'd probably choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to high price Disney hotels”
Reviews.Author: ahamm123
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel twice so far. One time just my husband and I in a standard room and another night with our 6 month old daughter in a 1 bedroom suite. The hotel is very quiet and nicely appointed. It is minutes from the DIsney entrance and there is a small plaza right down the road with various restaurants. The rooms are very nice and quiet. Breakfast is wonderful, the pool is small but just enough for our small family. We will definitely be staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Mason-family-05855
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 week in september 2011 and it was GREAT! Rooms were clean and the employees were VERY NICE! The staff in the lobby and resturant were so friendly we looked forward to seeing them every day they made us feel like family. We are planning to return to Orlando soon and will stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location away from the attractions and business.”
Reviews.Author: D_Auterson
Reviews.Content: I used this property for a business trip in order to close to I-4. It is very clean and well maintained and the location is great. Nearby shopping and restaurants and only minutes from attractions. Very quiet and little trafficked back street - nice place to retreat to.

Reviews.Title: “Sea World & Disney”
Reviews.Author: HGfromOmaha
Reviews.Content: My daughter and her best friend wanted to visit Orlando so we went down for a few days. I picked the Hilton Garden because I really enjoy staying at this hotel chain. This hotel did not disappoint. It was easy to find and quite accessible to both resorts. It was a 10 minute trip from our room to the front gate of Disney and about the same distance to Sea World. Stores and a huge mall were very close by. The room was comfortable and well appointed. The kitchen was a welcome feature that allowed me to save some cash on drinks, especially when you're talking about young ladies who like to have all sorts of energy drinks and juices. Room service cuts off at noon! Don't be late! Don't forget the hang tag on your door because they won't clean your room! Not a complaint. Just a statement. I am a cyclist and took my bicycle down for the week. There is no trail nearby and I wouldn't recommend riding on the roads near Disney. However, once you pass the tourist attractions, you can hop on a sidewalk that will run approximately 7 miles out toward the western part of town. From there, you can cut north about 5 miles to the West Orange Trail. What a nice trail! I rode up and down on that trail for days. Safe. Easy ride. Well marked. I saved my review about the Hilton Garden staff for last. The staff was unbelievable. They were so supportive. If I asked a question, they found an answer. Literally. Many people don't know about cycling and the hotel staff was no exception. However, they went above and beyond what is norm to find answers for me. Phone calls were made. Internet sources were checked and they found answers for me. I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The question isn't whether I will stay at this hotel again but "when" will I have a chance to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: RJ24R2
Reviews.Content: So I skipped the "discount" sites as they seem to leave you the cruddy rooms and wanted to have a nice night, so spend the extra $10 and found a good deal on the Hilton site, right near Disney. This hotel is located on the north outskirts of the Disney resort, and to anyone familiar with the strip of hotels and the restaurants along Palm Parkway this one is a little further than the others. Probably not gonna walk to them from here as you can from the others. Got there, checked in around dinner. Gave the desk the honors card, credit card and ID, asked for breakfast instead of points, and was then promptly asked to sit in lobby while she went over to other desk to print key. Then entered in to conversation with person at other desk helping guest find a Sally beauty supply. Apparently the only working computer couldn't search google maps and print my key simultaneously. 10 mins later we had a key. " how about the breakfast coupons" i asked " ooh i will send someone right up with them. I wasnt about to wait longer headed up to room. Whole ordeal was Pretty strange but ooh well. Once in the room, Noticed the bed was stuck on the 'ultra stiff' setting, regardless of where dial was. I jumped on the bed, adjusted the dial, no dice. ( most who have stayed at a hgi know the drill). I stopped by the desk on way out to dinner and asked for new room and the breakfast coupons that never showed. Coincidentally we waited in line behind a guy with same bed problem, as desk agent explained how to use bed. "try it again they said". He left dejected. "hi, I understand beds, and ours is broken. "ok we will send maintenance and if they can't fix we will put you in another room". Confident the bed was broken I was pretty sure we would come back to a new room. What we came back to was disappointment. No one had ever gone up to the room, and now (five hours later) they were full. When I really lost it, was when he offered me free breakfast to make up for their blunder. "dude I have free breakfast already, how many you want me to eat, by the way did those coupons ever make it too room?". "It says here they did sir" he replied. They sent maintenance up to room to "fix bed". Turns out he didn't even know where dial was. Perplexed I showed him and asked "ever fix one of these?" his response "Nope, never seen one.". That's when I noticed "security" emblazoned across his back. "man that thing is hard as a log. You are right. You can't sleep on that" were his words on way out "ok thanks for trying". I said as I picked up phone to call desk. We did sleep on it. Hard as a log and all. Manager comped room in am. All in all room was nice minus bed. But whole ordeal was off enough that I will never stay at that one again. And will think long and hard about a hgi again. Most Hampton inns and courtyards are just as nice and no possibility for broken bed as they are just normal. Ooh well. Room 617 was broken bed.

Reviews.Title: “I LIKE IT!!”
Reviews.Author: Rafael R
Reviews.Content: the bed is very nice, and the atention was very good with the latin people, just one bad point: poor in the variety of kind of food, but in other all its ok.

Reviews.Title: “Does not have disney room view rooms as posted on their website”
Reviews.Author: newjersey1Nj
Reviews.Content: 1. We booked through hotels.com. When we checked in the hotel has no record of the res so we had to wait to check in. 2. We wanted a disney view room but when we checked in we were told that the hilton website was wrong and they did not have disney view rooms. 3. I think the hotel was trying when they put the so called air beds in the rooms but the bed is just awful. It killed our backs. 4.The refrig was not working when we checked in. We called and was asked it we could wait till morning. The mext day we went to disney and came back about 8:00 and guess what...the refrig was still not working. We had to call the desk again and they came up and replaced it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the area!”
Reviews.Author: Teresa S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while visiting Orlando with friends. You cannot beat the location, it was probably two miles or less to the Disney World Resort, which was awesome. It also had several restaurants around it which is very nice if you want to avoid paying Disney food prices in the parks. The room itself was awesome. It was one of the cleanest hotels Iâ€™ve ever stayed in, and a clean hotel room is very important to me. Even on days when we had the â€œDo not Disturbâ€� sign up, they still left new towels and toiletries outside our room. We had a king bed, and the room had a refrigerator and microwave, which we needed, so that was awesome! They also had a fairly large pool for a hotel, as well as a hot tub, which was very nice after a long day at the parks, and both seemed clean. I also thought the staff was very professional and they greeted us every time we came down to the lobby or returned to the hotel. I have previously stayed at two Disney resorts as well as other hotels in the area, and I would highly recommend this one! I will definitely stay here again the next time I visit Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: vicmanuel
Reviews.Content: Room was excellent, super comfy beds. Great location and excellent choices of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Near Disney and Away From Congestion”
Reviews.Author: Miznitch
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel near the downtown disney area. The desk clerks were all very friendly and went out of their way to help me. Our room was spotless when we got there and was kept clean every day we stayed. I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What's up with the shower?”
Reviews.Author: Ayespye
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, nothing to write home about. I was not impressed with the "garden sleep system" on the beds. When the showers were built there was not a lot of thought put into it. In order to turn the shower on it is necessary to get in the shower and deal with the hot and cold water as you adjust the temperature... Terrible design! Additionally, the grab handle in the shower cannot be reached from outside the shower... Who thought this stuff up? Overall decent hotel. Was nice to have a fridge and microwave in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to HGI standards”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: Hair on towels in bathroom, disorganized at the front desk, failure to recognize HHonors status... It's not been an impressive start to this stay. One person working at the front desk. Had to wait 5+ minutes to check in while he gave directions to another guest over the phone. Didn't have breakfast or water vouchers ready - promised to deliver them to my room but by 9pm they still weren't there. Went down to the front desk to retrieve them and saw a woman (?) raiding the cookies ... She took a half dozen! When I commented I might like one for my 5 year old she just gave me a dirty look. It's an ok HGI, but not up the the standards I've grown accustomed to as an HHonors member who favors the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Definitely coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Marwa9
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Lake Buena Vista was fantastic. The hotel staff are very friendly and welcoming, always smily and polite. The rooms are a very good size, impeccable. Furniture and bathroom are modern and clean. The location is convenient to Disney and the Florida mall. The gym and pool are very adequate- all for a very decent price. Will definitely stay here if in Orlando again. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: sisphoenix76
Reviews.Content: Good central spot in Orlando. Not a super comfy bed, and there was hair in our shower, but otherwise clean. Good price considering how expensive Orlando is. Staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best location ever for our conference.”
Reviews.Author: EyeTrain4You
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely amazing! The employees went out of their way to do whatever it took to make us happy. Les was a gem-he is a great asset to your business. Thank you for providing a wonderful conference location. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worthy of Hilton Name”
Reviews.Author: KelleyAndMatt
Reviews.Content: Despite the extremely friendly staff, this hotel is one I would never recommend to any traveler to the Orlando FL area - there are so many from which to choose, don't choose this one if you have the least bit of allergic sensitivities. Upon our arrival I instantly had an allergic reaction to the room, something I have never experienced in my extensive travels. The air in the room literally made my eyes watery and red; the bedding smelled as if it had been cleaned in a vat of caustic chemicals. It was a clean room, the hotel itself being under two years old; and it was an average hotel room, being not too small. However, this was clearly not up to Hilton standards. I have to admit I have never stayed at a Hilton Garden hotel before, my experience with Hilton has always been their "regular" properties (and I always try to stay at Hilton because of their quality). If this represents what their Garden properties are like I will never choose another - ever. The room was clean, and contained all the amenities advertised, however the bed (the most important part of the room) was terrible. I'm no princess, but when I stay at a Hilton I expect certain things: quality of service (which this hotel had in abundance), and quality of bedding (which left me very ill). I seriously thought I was going to have to see a doctor or find a different hotel because of the horrible reaction I had to the bedding. The duvet and pillows were filled with feathers; I have never had a reaction to feathers so I did not request a hypo-allergenic room. I will in the future. After one night of sleeping on those god-awful pillows my eyes were extremely red, itchy and watery, my throat was closing up and I felt I couldn't get air into my lungs. After a solid week of sleeping in that atmosphere I could not wait to leave. I also picked up some kind of intestinal virus that had me vomitting and "other " delightful things which, according to a member of the staff, was "going around, everyone's got it here." Lovely. Not. We got up early and hit the parks and the fresh air and sunshine worked wonders on my condition, however we'd arrive back at the hotel and instantly my body would react: red, itchy, watery eyes, scratchy throat, and my lungs felt like I'd never get enough air in them. I had a very difficult week of trying to sleep and had to use Advil PM several nights just to get enough sleep. The staff was wonderful - Kevin the bartender is an awesome guy, the women who ran the breakfast were equally wonderful and friendly. The main desk staff was overworked at times and slow to answer the phone, however one person manning the main desk had their hands full. Even though pantry items were expensive they were less costly than buying stuff in the parks; recommend buying up several bottles of water there and take them with you to the parks, as $2.50 for a bottle at the hotel was cheaper by far than the $3.50 bottle in Disney. You can bring backpacks with water and snack foods into the parks, so do it! The cost of the room was adequate, however another Hilton property within the Disney hotel band was the same rate with 100% higher quality. I'd stayed at that other property before but could not get a room this trip - in comparison - for the money - the other Hilton was far superior in the quality of the room and the overall stay. This Hilton - the Garden Inn on Marbella Parkway - was more like a Holiday Inn. Infact, I believe the Holiday Inn express down the street would have been a better choice for several reasons: they offered free breakfast, and were very close to the Crossroads where all the restaurants and shops are located. Breakfast at the Hilton Garden was pretty good - the cost was great as everything in Orlando is horribly expensive, so $6.95 for continental breakfast and $8.95 for full breakfast was very cost effective, however the Hilton Garden Inn was not near anything so you had little choice where to eat or drink for other meals; it was a taxi ride or a bus ride to anywhere you wanted to go. They are only about 18 months old as of this writing, so they do have some "bugs" to iron out, but unless they change the way they clean the bedding, or change the bedding all together, they will never have me as a guest again. Note: the Links bus system is the way to go if you don't rent a car in Orlando, research it before you go to the area as it is $2 for one ride or $4.50 for the entire day of transferring from one bus to the other to go all over Orlando; taxis charge $15+ for oneway from this hotel to the Downtown Disney area and $25 to any of the parks. The bus was $2. A no-brainer there... doesn't go to the major parks but the hotel offers a shuttle. About the shuttle: I read a complaint on this site about the shuttle service before we left and chalked it up to just a complainer who couldn't be satisfied. I was wrong. The shuttle system was very limited. Three pick-up times in the morning, and three drop- off times in the evening. I was attending classes so I couldn't hop a shuttle after class to meet up with my spouse at the parks; we had to meet at the hotel, and didn't want to pay for a taxi to the parks. If the shuttle had been available at those times we'd have gone to the parks for the evening. The bus driver the first few days was nicknamed Grumpy because of his nasty disposition; we noticed he wasn't around the rest of the week and were glad. They work on tips, so you'd expect a nicer driver. Go figure. He was rude and nasty. The other drivers were very nice, however. But the pick up times were not very convenient. Not the hotel's fault, however this is the service with which they contract. Get to know the Epcot shuttle system well before you go, as you need to catch either a bus, boat or monorail to go to the other parks from Epcot. The shuttle system from the Hilton Garden only takes you to Epcot, which is the central hub for the Disney parks (all the shuttles work this way). Take the earliest bus out (7:55am); the parks mostly open between 8am-9am. For the rest of the hotel: the pool was tiny, but it was open until 10pm with bar and restaurant walk-up service. You share it with another property, the Residence Inn. The restaurant had adequate food - not great, but not awful either. Priced within means, didn't break the bank for meals. The bar was small but Kevin the bartender was excellent. Overall I was disappointed in this hotel property. Not worthy of "Hilton" status, but not a terrible hotel. If it were any other brand I wouldn't be writing this review.

Reviews.Title: “Management in incompetent, beds are smelly!”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyagedayana
Reviews.Content: One day while changing in my room, the housekeeping manager knocked on the door and I told her I was in there and she proceeded to come in while I was naked. Instead of leaving immediately she started to inspect the room (I am still standing there naked) with the door open and people walking by. I had to walk to the door and ask her to leave immediately and she kept going on and on about her duty of checking the room. When I approached management I was told about 'my duty to keep the sign on the door'. I never got an apology!! I am astonished! They must have a problem with their beds, they both smelled fungus like. Very disgusting! The rooms were dirty too. Good location, but you have a million other options in that area. Breakfast was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean in a quiet location for the area”
Reviews.Author: Penglynns
Reviews.Content: A very clean and contemporary looking hotel with friendly staff in a location that is surprisingly isolated and quiet for that part of Orlando. Minutes east of the Downtown Disney area but far enough off the beaten path to feel a little out of the way (though it is not). Only minuses: no fans in the bathroom (a problem we've seen at other Hiltons) and the shower design makes it easy to wind up with a wet floor (so put down a towel ahead of time to avoid slipping when exiting).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel .. very small issues”
Reviews.Author: xcoaster1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Being outside the Downtown Disney area by about 1 mile or so, I understand it is still apart of the Good Neighbor Hotel program by Disney. The hotel is a standard Garden Inn with the new RFID room keys which make getting into the room so much quicker. The parking is shared with the Homewood Suites next door. My only complaint regarding the hotel besides the distance from food and Disney was the fact they do offer shuttle service, but on a very very limited schedule. They have 2-3 pickups in the morning hours and 2-3 at night .. which doesn't work for alot of people that want the freedom to come and go to the parks and hotel. I was upset about this but found my way around this by parking at Downtown Disney for free and hoping a bus back over the EPCOT. I would not recommend this however, as they may tow a car, but this was a Saturday night and there was a concert that night so everything was open late.

Reviews.Title: “A good option if you stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: remintz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few weeks while working at Orlando. It has all good convenience you may expect from a nice hotel plus a nice and convenient location if you are interested in visiting Orlando parks and attractions. Breakfast is nice, nice beds and rooms, and nice service at the front desk and restaurant. One weak point to mention though: food at the restaurant (besides the breakfast) is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Capodicapi2
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel to visit Disney World and Universal, and we were more than satisfied with this hotel. The rooms was amazing in size and comfortness; the location is really good being only 5 minute drive to Disney, Universal and also to the little shopping centers in the area. My only complaint is that it would have been nice to receive some help with our luggage....but I guess that's the policy for Hilton Garden Inns.

Reviews.Title: “"Complimentary" Theme Park Transportation Inconvenience, Cancellation, Loss of Customer”
Reviews.Author: emcstuff
Reviews.Content: We live just down the road in Tampa and frequently travel to the Orlando area 5-6 times per year for weekend getaways be it for relaxation at resort stays or as annual theme park pass holders for easy overnight stays. Our criteria for selecting the Hilton Garden Inn was as follows: 1 - transportation to/from Epcot Food/Wine Festival, 2 - free hotel parking, 3 - online hotel reviews, 4 - price, and 5 - brand recognition. Upon arrival at the hotel at 10:35 a.m. we were informed that the shuttle departed to the park at 10:20 a.m. and that the following shuttle would depart at 12:30 p.m. Rather than spend 2 hours waiting for the next shuttle we opted to absorb the fare for a one way taxi ($25) and start our day. (I was disappointed that the website made no mention of the limited/fixed scheduled departures.) My assumption or expectation for shuttle service would have been departures either each half hour, on the hour, or as needed courtesy car/van ride departures for guests that arrive throughout the day. I accept fault for assuming the infrequency of "complimentary" rides and for not calling ahead to check. Per the return shuttle service schedule, we were to meet the shuttle at the Epcot Center Transportation area at 9:45 p.m. Never having used a shuttle service before, to any theme park, we returned to the location where the taxi dropped us off - again, assuming the hotels used the same parking lot as all other public transportation carriers (i.e. taxis, shuttles) for pickup at the "Disney Transportation and Ticketing Center." We arrived there via monorail at around 9:35 p.m. and immediately called the front desk at the hotel to determine the pickup location. We spent a few minutes on the phone, walking around, and asking other drivers present where we needed to be. After a day long of drinking (alcohol), eating, walking, etc., it was a careless (and honest) mistake to not locate the "Epcot Center Transportation" area; however, having never used a shuttle service before, we were unaware that Epcot had its own parking/pickup area separate from the Disney Ticketing and Transportation Center - the assumption being that all public transportation occurs at one location. What's more frustrating was that the receptionist at the front desk of the hotel was unable to tell us where we needed to go or where we needed to be for the shuttle pickup thus we missed the pickup time. Needless to say, we ended up paying another $25 to catch a ride back to the hotel. Between the cab fares and hotel rate, we should have just stayed on Disney property where they are far more concerned with customer service and satisfaction. The ball drop occurred when we arrived at the hotel to check in and speak to the manager regarding the miscommunicated advertisement regarding "complimentary" transportation. It was neither convenient nor was there any indication of schedule departure times on the website. Given that the hotel staff was unable to tell us where we needed to be causing us to miss our "free" ride back, I found it unnecessary that we should have to cover the return trip cost. The "best" the manager could do for us was to cancel our reservation without charge. Outstanding attention to customer service Hilton especially after a long day. "Allow" your guest to cancel their reservation without offering anything to keep us as a customer was an easy out for not having to deal with an upset customer. A free breakfast voucher for the morning after would have been sufficient. (Breakfast is not free FYI.) Having to get in a car in Orlando at 10 p.m., exhausted, upset, after a "Food/Wine" event, to look for someplace else to stay was by far the biggest insult and contradicting to the service the hotel provides. Needless to say, you've lost a customer for life. As a paying customer, I reserve the right to choose where I stay and who I share my experience with - forever. Never again will I stay at a Hilton owned/branded hotel. You left us stranded - literally.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: magon121254
Reviews.Content: I have been somewhat merciless when I've reviewed European hotels in Tripadvisor. This hotel and other's like it in the U.S. is the reason why. The hotel is about 1 1/2 yrs. old. It offers everything, from pool to fitness room to business center, and it's all new and well maintained. Our room boasted two queen beds with adjustable firmness mattresses. The T.V. was hi-def, with two variants of HBO on it and the rest of the gamut of cable channels (Discovery, History Channel, USA, CNN, etc.). The room had a small refrigerator and a microwave. The bathroom was equipped with a hair dryer and offered complimentary shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash and body cream in adequate sized bottles. The rooms appointments were new, well maintained and spanking clean. There was more than an adequate number of lamps/lighting, and the window curtains actually kept the daylight out if unwanted. The price for me and two teens? $85.00 per night, plus $10.63 taxes. The only drawback is that it's a little bit secluded, but it's surrounded by small restaurants and shops in nice, new malls, and is about 10 mins. driving distance from Downtown Disney. Also, it's quiet. For me, it was money very well spent, and the kids liked it as well. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “good location, not far away from disney,”
Reviews.Author: zerberus1980
Reviews.Content: i stayed with my family for about 10 days in this facility. There is hardly something to complain, except for the pool, with was a bit dirty. complaints were handled quickly and to my full satisfaction. Room was clean and spacious. Fast internet connection was available. The staff was helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, friendly and well located”
Reviews.Author: Alastair126
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks to do the full theme park holiday, and the hotel was generally excellent. The hotel was easy to find when we arrived late afternoon, the check in was very quick and friendly. The room was excellent, large, well equipped with microwave, quite fridge and good air-con. Supremely comfy bed, good shower and we would highly recommend it. The food was of a very good standard, we had breakfast there most days and was consistently good. We ate on two occasions in the evening, once via room service and once on arrival in the restaurant, there is a good selection on the menu and the food and service was very good. As for access to the parks, dining etc everything is a car ride away you could probably walk to Pizza Hut or the local shopping centre in about 15 min, but it is not paved for the first section of the walk. For the parks setting off at 08:30 (in Sept) got us to Universal or any of the Disney's car parks by 09:00 Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time here”
Reviews.Author: FitzD
Reviews.Content: we had a nice time at this hotel. enjoyed the pool and the room was good. no compliants. its a short distance to the Downtown Disney area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and new, but generic”
Reviews.Author: TiffiniT
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Free shuttle to Epcot * New property / clean and attractive * Free parking (rare for Disney-area hotels) * Free Internet in business center * Nice pool and hot tub area, fun for kids * Hotel restaurant has delicious food, reasonably priced. We loved the $9 all you can eat breakfast buffet including fresh-prepared omelets. Much better food and a cheaper price than venturing out to a restaurant for breakfast. Friendly service too. * Mini-kitchenette in rooms including fridge, microwave, cabinet/drawer. Cons: * Hard mattresses * Can't walk to anything, like you can when you stay on Disney property * Read your reservation's fine print to make sure you get the type of room you need. A mix-up forced my two friends and me to sleep in the same bed the first night, and they had no cots left. Good thing we're close friends, LOL. * Kind of generic hotel overall; don't expect anything charming or memorable. But perfectly adequate. * Small rooms

Reviews.Title: “Good value--out of the way”
Reviews.Author: SoulSabbatical
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was newer and the price was great. It is just off the Disney property and a five minute drive to Downtown Disney. It still takes about an hour from the hotel to Main Street USA...but that's mainly due to getting parked at Disney. Hotel is very nice, clean, and feels new. Carpets in my room were a little in need of cleaning. The rooms are a little small, but very well put together. Free wireless internet. Breakfast, though is not included and is about $9.00 a person. The hotel is located kinda off the beaten path. You can see if from I-4, but getting to it is a bit odd at first--eventually, it doesn't seem so weird. Beds are very firm.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Orlando By Far!!!!”
Reviews.Author: VisalusBob
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel over 80 times in last year and have NEVER had a bad experience. Everyone from John, Renee, and Tony in Management to Ebony in Reservations to Jamie and Marleen at the front desk go out of their way to make me feel at home. They have an absolutely beautiful pool and huge hottub, wonderful workout area and some of the best food and best prices of any hotel I have stayed at. If every Hilton Hotel met the standards of this one nobody would ever even think of staying at another brand...Great job guys and you know I will keep referring everyone I know

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Hard Beds, Not as close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: bishoparc
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night stay at this hotel thinking it was really close to Disney based upon some of the reviews I read but it isn't. This hotel is located on an isolated road about 3-5 miles away from Downtown Disney. It is on a road with about 3 other hotels in the middle of nowhere. I guess they started to build a hotel community and it kind of flopped or just hasn't developed yet. Don't get me wrong, you're still really close to the back entrance of Disney but it isn't within walking distance of anything. Check in was very quick and easy. Room was very clean but the bed was extremely hard. I did not sleep well at all. The hotel appears fairly new so it is quite clean. My other complaint is that there is no back entrance to the hotel, only the front door so if you have to park out back you can't go in a back door to get out of rain or anything. They have doors that enter conference rooms but those are locked so you can't use them. Hotel advertises "Disney View" rooms, I didn't stay in one but trust me there is no way you are seeing anything at Disney from this hotel. Hotel advertises proximity keys so that you don't have to swipe anything to open your room but you still have to swipe the key right on top of the reader for it to open the door. Overall for the price it was ok but the hardness of the bed made it a place I won't stay again. It literally felt like I was laying on a piece of plywood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: A2Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly new. In a nice location with nice comfortable rooms. There is a nice pool area. Breakfast is good and a good way to get your day started without having to leave hotel. All the rooms have a fridge. For families this is great as there is a Publix right around the corner. This will save you a lot of money. It's also on a road with several decent reasonably priced restaurands including an Outback, Carrabas, and several other chains. These are good if you don't want to break the bank at Disney/Universal restaurants. It's a 5 minute drive to Disney with no traffic. 10 to 15 with traffic. I will agree with a previous poster. When I entered my top floor room, there was definitely a strong moldy/musty smell. They were very nice and moved me to another top floor room. That room also had a slight moldy smell as well, although no where near the first room I had. I guess you might want to avoid the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Property was clean and well appointed evening Restaurant service....”
Reviews.Author: artieboy
Reviews.Content: Hotel physically is in great shape. Service in the daytime was great and then the sun goes down and the night shift comes in and it's lacking at best. F& B was the biggest offender. Otherwise great!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SUEANNE4
Reviews.Content: Friendly ,clean and pleasant hotel with good amenities. fridge, microwave and excellent free internet very useful. rooms serviced nicely everyday. nice swimming pool plenty of sunbeds and towels available. Didnt use restaurant but seemed to have reasonable variety with a special cheap meal each day. Only negative was a little farther out than thought so def need a car but this also made it a nice quiet location. Thought good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, skip paying extra for the 'disney view'”
Reviews.Author: aberdeenterrier
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent- clean and spacious, had a great nights sleep. It might be a 'mile from the park' as it says on the website but it must be the furthest boundary as it was much further than a mile on the shuttle bus. I spent an extra $10 for a disney facing view. Don't bother, we could barely make out the Epcot golf ball. It was still a good deal for the room though. the shuttle only runs to the parks til 12:30, then resumes at 5pm or so. I didn't know this and we ended up spending $20 on a cab to get to the parks as we didn't arrive til a little after one. I even called to confirm they had a disney shuttle but this little fact wasn't mentioned. Next time I will know to ask. Staff was friendly & courteous. Breakfast was really good but dinner not so much. Room service staff was good but the food was not. The fries were ore-idas I think, not 'real' fries, my burger was overly seasoned. I don't think they have a real chef at night, more of a micro-waver. over all it was a nice hotel but I think next time I will try to find something closer to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: relientkrocks
Reviews.Content: My family of four recently spent two nights at this hotel. Also 3 members of my extended family stayed in a handicap room for one night. The location was nice, just a minute off the main drag into Disney property. Our room was a traditional Hilton Garden Inn room, not too spacious. Our room had a small fridge and a microwave. Our first night after spending the day at Disney, we went down to the pool area for the hot tub. The hallway to get to the pool on the first floor is also where some of the hotel rooms are. The carpet smelled like mildew, we figured because of people walking in wet from the pool. Also the hot tub smelled like there was too much soap mixed it. It wasn't very relaxing since it didn't smell good. The pool was also not heated. They did provide towels by the pool which was nice. The pool was also open until 10. We suggested to the front desk to consider extending the hours, so people coming from Disney parks can go a relax. Another inconvience was when housekeeping only gave us two new towels and no new bath mat, with four people staying in the room. We had to call the front desk at 11pm to get more. Usually it wouldn't be a big deal, but after spending all day at Disney it was a bit of hassel. Breakfast was $8.95 for buffet style and a chef that cooks omlets and eggs. There were plenty of options and they even had Belgian waffles in the shape of Mickey Mouse which was a nice touch. The handicap room was very spacious and perfect for an eldery relative that needed the space. Our day of check-out was a Sunday morning. Our room was on the second floor so the elevator was full on it's way up or down so we ended up standing with all of our luggage for 10 minutes waiting on an open elevator. Overall, the hotel was just okay. Nothing to brag about and nothing to make me upset. Just little things that made the stay less than perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: TrinityAlexis
Reviews.Content: The location is off the main drag, but very convenient to everything. Beautiful hotel. Rooms were very comfy and clean with upgraded amenities. Big bathroom. Outdoor pool is beautiful but not heated. They have a small half basketball court on premises and a pretty good fitness center overlooking the pool. Small game room. Elevators were very quick. Front desk staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. The area is very busy, so be prepared to wait at restaurants almost all the time.

Reviews.Title: “This was affordable, clean and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: johnpaul1
Reviews.Content: If you want a quiet hotel in Orlando that is newer, this would be a good choice. We used the pool and hot tub and slept there. Otherwise we spent our days out enjoying the theme parks. The room had a fridge and microwave, which we used. The beds were comfortable and the staff was courteous and helpful. If you don't have a car it might be inconvenient, otherwise there is shopping and restaurants within 3 or 4 minutes driving.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, good location, but the services need to improve.”
Reviews.Author: PMLC
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband, my mother and my sister stayed in two rooms in the period from 12/28/09 to 01/06/2010, on the fourth floor. The facilities are new, the hotel is very well located. However, two drawbacks have occurred during our stay. For two nights the fire alarm shot at the same time, about 5/6h00 am, without any explanation. Moreover, at the time of check out, my husband left for 30 minutes a bag with some souvenirs near the lobby, but it was taken by someone, without any hotel employee had seen. Otherwise, In the end, our vacations was good!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure they actually keep a room for you”
Reviews.Author: andercjole
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a room with this hotel for a business trip. I am a regular user of Hilton hotels and prefer the Garden Inns for their cleanliness, attention to detail and accommodations that appease to business travelers. However, even though I booked a room here, I wouldn't be able to tell you what it was like. Upon arrival to this hotel, at 8:00 PM, I was greeted by a maintenance worker who told me that he would try and find someone to check me in. After 5 minutes the manager (Bill or Bob?) finally arrived and checked me in. He was very unprofessional, especially for being a manager, which foreshadowed nicely what happened next. After completing check-in, I headed to my room and started opening the door when I heard a scream. The manager had given me a room with someone already in it!!!! After apologizing to the poor people in "my" room I headed back downstairs. I explained what had happened and the manager was more concerned with trying to figure out who to blame, than apologizing to me and the embarrassment I had just gone through. After looking in his computer he explained that the hotel was sold out and I couldn't get a room, even though I had a confirmation of my reservation. The manager then explained that they were going to "upgrade" me to the Homewood Suites. His attempt at trying to sugar coat the situation did not make me happy. Homewood Suites is not an upgrade to the Hilton Garden Inn, especially for a business traveler. Maybe it is an upgrade if you are a family and need a kitchen and an extra room. There is a reason why the rate is slightly more expensive at Homewood, because a room can sleep 7 people. Having no other options, I took the room at the Homewood suites and it was less than average compared to the hundreds of hotels that I have stayed at. My stay was capped off nicely when I reached for a fresh towel that was covered in yellow stains. My adviceâ€¦if you book a room at this hotel, make sure that you will actually get it when you show up. There are millions of hotels in Florida and about 30 others within 2 miles of this place. You might want to try another one. Also, some of the resorts in the area are discounting their rates because of the lower tourism rates in the Orlando area. Spend an extra $50-100 and get a better room with more assurance that you won't be stranded when you get here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Follow-up service”
Reviews.Author: hotelmarketer
Reviews.Content: My son recently stayed at the hotel along with his school band. He left his ipod in the room safe when they departed. The next day, when he got home, he gave me the information. I called to the hotel and talked to Tony at the front desk. Tony quickly retreived the ipod, gave me a call and then we arranged to have it sent back. It took a few days longer than I had expected so I called back. Tony remembered the incident, gave me the tracking number and the ipod made it home safely and very well packaged! Tony was helpful and courteous throughout our conversations. This is excellent customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Good night to start my vacation”
Reviews.Author: vegasrick71
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very new and beautiful. Safe quiet area, maybe not walking distance to shops, but is very close by car (one exit on I-4) to Disney parks, as well as shops, dining, etc... My only complaint was during check in the front desk person was more involved in a personal phone call than in taking care of me. Sorry but after travelling all day, I wanted to quickly check in and get some rest.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location and price...”
Reviews.Author: BabaJee
Reviews.Content: This was the least expensive Hilton we could find that was so close to Disney. We were one exit away - roughly 10 minute from hotel to the parking lot at the Magic Kingdom. The hotel is nice and new. Our room was a typical 2 queen hotel room with free internet and a fridge with microwave. Fridge and microwave are very important for us, since we're traveling with kids. It had a swimming pool, wedged in between adjacent hotel. While I'm sure it was a good sized pool, the big fence around it made you feel like a prisoner. Not very welcoming and not very vacation-like! Nice, modern, clean and close. Service wasn't so great. Junior staff weren't very helpful and the breakfast was a big mess. Normally it's about $10 for breakfast. That price was included in our stay. The only problem is that at rush hour, there's a massive line to order eggs. There's one egg guy with 3 pans juggling orders for custom eggs. It took us forever to get to the front and the kids were going crazy. Everything here was self service, not worth the $10 for a very limited buffet. The staff was overworked and constantly behind in everything. The waffle batter ran out and took them 15 minutes to replace it after about 3 reminders. What to do? I had a 5 year old that was demanding waffles!!! Not a good start to the day - we wasted a lot of time for a disappointing breakfast. I recommend not getting the breakfast, unless there's no line with the egg guy. Other than that, it was a great hotel! Highly recommended for families going to Disney. We went in February and our nightly rate was less than $100 including breakfast. A hotel this modern for that price cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: jsmom321
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last night of Disney trip. We had been at Disney's Pop Century for the previous 5 nights, but when we tried to add the 6th night after checking in (our plans hadn't been firmed up until then), they would not give us the same rate as when we booked. So after some trip advisor searching we came across Hilton Garden Inn. We got $71/ nt rate. The hotel is brand new and clean. Very quiet, awesome breakfast (they let us eat for free even though it wasn't included in our rate). Close to Downtown Disney. However, you will need a car, there is nothing within walking distance and their shuttles to Epcot are few and far between.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: annjodan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on your site and we were not disappointed. It was easy to find off Palm Parkway in Lake Buena Vista, but just away from the busy restaurant area that was 2 mins away. This is a new hotel and everything is clean and fresh. The room was big and had everything in down to a fridge and microwave. The bathroom had a big walk-in shower and a decent hairdryer. Once in our room we never heard any noise coming from the corridor or outside, we were on the fourth floor. We had breakfast in the hotel most mornings which was a buffet, it had everything that you could want in cold foods and hot, it made me wish i could eat more. Whenever we returned back to the hotel through the day or evening there were hot cookies on the front desk that you could have for free, they were lovely. We would definately stay there again as it was handy for getting to all the attractions. Ebony on the desk was always a happy face to see on return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault the place”
Reviews.Author: gazmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights initially, but extended our stay another 2 as it was so good. Room was clean, well appointed, quiet. The maid was great with everything being replaced promptly. The only point is that you will need a car to get to all of the attractions and places to eat, but that's the same with everywhere in the US so a minor point at that. Really good value for money, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and great location!”
Reviews.Author: rlewis937
Reviews.Content: If you are around the Disney area and not staying on Disney property this is a great location with very nice accommodations. It is a new hotel and offers a nice deal with the bed and breakfast plan so that you can enjoy a buffet hot breakfast rather than just cold cereal and toast. The beds in Hilton's hotels are always superb-very comfortable after a long day working or playing. The front desk staff was attentive and quick to answer questions and the restaurant is open late for sit down or room service. It has a decent menu, although the pizza lacked in flavor and toppings. A good value for solo or family travelers in a great location close to Downtown Disney, all the parks, and many restaurants and shopping opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC IN EVERY WAY”
Reviews.Author: miamimickey140
Reviews.Content: We stayed Dec 4-6th Had a 2-queen beds. Went with Partner and 10 year old. LOCATION: Its about 5-8min drive to Downtown Disney area. They do have Free Transfers to Disney if you choose. Location is not walking distance to any food place unless you like to really walk some. but its not terrible at all. GROUNDS: Very nice since its all new. LOBBY: Nice and modern. Has fireplace and large sitting area for people to relax and enjoy the warmth (especially during these cold Orando months) Front desk service was the best. I checked in in less then 3min. It was all ready when i got there...just had to present ID. PARKING: Plenty of parking. ROOM: Again...all new. Flat screen TV. Water saving shower with massage. Nice counters. Fridge and Microwave. My only complaint is the beds were a bit on the hard side....but not as bad as they are in Europe!! (haha). Over all i loved the rooms size and modern feel. There is a small mart for chips and drinks. There was a pool....which we didnt use because it was cold. They also have breakfast (at a cost) and we didnt eat there...but it was pretty full and food looked and smelled good. (im sure it was) OVERALL: i love this place location and price. Overall I love this hotel. I will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “awesome value, brand new hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAbuddy2000
Reviews.Content: I was looking at hotels near Walt Disney World and booked the Hilton Garden Inn - great price and extremely happy with the hotel. 1) No resort fee. The non-disney resort fee hotels are 5 minutes closer to the park. In orlando, nothing is walking distance and you should rent a car. Took about 15 minutes to epcot, 10 minutes to downtown disney. 2) Everything is new, or looks recently refurbished. Flat screen TV's in the room. Marple bath and accents. 3) Low price, we booked for under $70 through orbitz. 4) Free wifi, free newspaper M-F. Didnt use the pool or other services. Quality exceeded my expectations for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Friendly Reception, Excellent Room”
Reviews.Author: awarded
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with this booking. We spent alot of time researching where to stay and decided to stay here for 2 weeks. We didn't feel too overwhelmed by the exterior when we arrived. The reception staff were very welcoming however and continued to be over our stay, especially the offer of cookies available most evenings! The beds were very comfortable and we felt that our room was good value. The only issue we encountered was relating to breakfast. This felt unorganised and almost awkward at times. Seemingly a popular choice, Eggs were also not available on some of our sittings which was frustrating. The location is excellent, situated roughly half way between Disney's parks and Universal (Disney is slightly nearer) , Seaworld is just around the corner. You wont need to travel for more than 5-10 mins by car whether your going to Downtown Disney or to Universal's Citywalk. A large strip mall is also nearby with major brand outlets. Other things which stood out for us were use of the business facilities - two computers with printer and internet access all for free, a small Gym area which is open 24 hrs and free parking. This certainly felt like a nice place to stay for 2 weeks and we looked forward to coming back here after some very long days.

Reviews.Title: “nice new property”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: Only thing to complain about is the weird shower defect (see below). Otherwise, nice new hotel with excellent rooms. I thought breakfast was pretty good and, if it's not included in your rate, not a bad deal for $8.99.

Reviews.Title: “WE HAD A WONDERFULL STAY AT THIS PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: bob1223
Reviews.Content: M family of four booked this hotel for a trip to Disney, when we arrived I was pleasantly suprised. The hotel was very clean and the staff very pleasant. The hotel was clean and quiet which was important after visitng at the park all day and two small children. We will be staying again . Thanks again for a great stay

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Garden Inn Lake Buena Vista/Orlando
HotelInfo.Address: 11400 Marbella Palm Court, Orlando, FL 32836
